Scheme_Name: Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)
Details: The scheme "Construction of Dudhghar/ Godown (Scheduled Caste Area)" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial support to Village Milk Producer Co-operative Societies in Scheduled Caste areas that lack their own milk storage or cattle feed storage infrastructure. It also promotes installation of bulk milk coolers and similar equipment.
Benefits: Name of the ComponentStandard of assistanceRemarksMinimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming BenefitsDudhghar/ GodownUnit price (Rs10,00,000/-)or actual expenditure occurs for construction, out of that 50% of whichever is less.Maximum Rs5,00,000/-Once in lifetime
Eligibility: The Society must not already own a Dudhghar or Godown.The Society must have its own land available for the construction of the Dudhghar or Godown.The Society must not have availed of the benefit earlier under this or any other scheme for a similar purpose.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Step 2: On the home page, click on 'Schemes' and then click on 'Animal Husbandry Schemes'.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the 'Apply' button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.Note: Required Documents can also be submitted in hard copies to the office mentioned in the application form within 7 days.
Documents_Required: Copy of Bank Passbook or cancelled cheque.Proof of own land for construction of Dudhghar/Godown.Certificate of not availing benefit earlier in same scheme/other scheme with similar purpose by Managing Director of Dairy Union.

Scheme_Name: Scheme of Assistance for Management of Stray Cattle
Details: The "Scheme of Assistance for Management of Stray Cattle" is designed to support Panjrapoles (animal shelters) registered under the Public Charity Act in their efforts to manage and maintain stray cattle. Each eligible shelter receives a one-time maintenance assistance for stray cattle to ensure proper care, control, and management of these animals.
Benefits: ComponentName Support Standard	Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Constituent BenefitsManagement of stray cattle	Rs4000/- maintenance assistance will be payable once for each stray cattle1 year
Eligibility: The Panjrapole (animal shelter) must be registered under the Charity Act.The Panjrapole must accept and maintain stray cattle in their facility.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Step 2: On the home page, click on 'Schemes' and then click on 'Animal Husbandry Schemes'.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the 'Apply' button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the online application and submit it to the board within 30 days of application with the signature and stamp of the local Veterinary Officer with the necessary documents listed in the application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
Documents_Required: Registration certificate under the Public Charity Act.Signature/ stamp of the local veterinary officer.Any other documents as required.

Scheme_Name: National Family Benefit Scheme (Maharashtra)
Details: The scheme "National Family Benefit Scheme (Maharashtra)" is a social welfare scheme by the Social Justice & Special Assistance Department, Government of Maharashtra. Under this scheme, in the event of the death of the primary breadwinner of a BPL family, the family is provided with a one-time lump sum financial assistance of Rs20,000/-.
Benefits: Financial assistance of Rs20,000/-.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Maharashtra.The applicant should be a family member or dependent of the deceased breadwinner (an earning member of the family on whom the family primarily depended for income).The family should be living Below the Poverty Line (BPL).The deceased should have been between 18 and 59 years old.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Collector Office/Tahsildar/Talathi of your district, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the concerned authority.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the concerned authority.Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).NOTE: Ensure that the application is submitted within the prescribed period, if any.
Documents_Required: Identity Proof of the Applicant I.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID CardIdentity Proof of the Deceased Person i.e. Aadhaar CardDeath Certificate of the Deceased PersonFIR CopyProof of Age of the Deceased PersonBelow Poverty Line (BPL) Card/ Ration CardCaste Certificate (if Applicable)Address ProofBank Passbook/Bank Account DetailsAny Other Documents as Required

Scheme_Name: Mukhyamantri Rajya Bridhhabasta Pension Yojana
Details: Launched by the Department of Women, Child Development & Social Security, Government of Jharkhand, "Mukhyamantri Rajya Bridhhabasta Pension Yojana" aims to provide financial support to the senior citizens of Jharkhand who do not have any stable source of income or their  income is not enough to support them or is insufficient. It is a Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) scheme, so the pension amount will be directly transferred to the bank account of the beneficiary.
Benefits: Amount: Rs 1,000/- per month to the eligible beneficiary.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Jharkhand.The applicant should have attained the age of 60 years or more.The applicant should have a Voter ID card and Aadhar Card.The applicant should not be a beneficiary under any other Social Security pension scheme.The applicant or their spouse should not be a Retired or permanently employed in Central and State Government or in public sector undertakings.The applicant or their spouse should not be a recipient of Government pension or pension from Central and State Government or from public sector undertakings.Applicant's family is not an income tax payee.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 01: The interested applicant should request the prescribed format of the application from the office of Block Development Officer (BDO) / Sub Divisional Officer (SDO) / Circle OfficerStep 02: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 03: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned authority at:Office of the BDO in rural areas.Office of the SDO or Circle Officer in Municipalities and notified areas.
Documents_Required: Copy of Voter ID card (in case, applicants age is 18 years or more).Copy Aadhar Card (in case the applicant does not have an Aadhar Card they need to submit a Self-declaration for not having the same).Copy of Bank Passbook.Self-declaration regarding the eligibility.Age Proof.
Search_Keywords: Mukhyamantri Rajya Bridhhabasta Pension Yojana, mrbpy, Direct Benefit Transfer, Old Age, Pension, Senior Citizen, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Special Financial Assistance Scheme for Meritorious Students of the State for Preparation of Competitive Examinations
Details: The scheme 'Special Financial Assistance Scheme for Meritorious Students of the State for Preparation of Competitive Examinations' was introduced by the Higher Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial support to meritorious students who have cleared the preliminary examination conducted by the State or Union Public Service Commission for Group 'A' and 'B' services, or the written examination for the Armed Forces (e.g., NDA, CDS, OTA, Indian Naval Academy, Indian Air Force Academy, etc.). Under this scheme, a one-time grant of Rs50,000/- is provided to each eligible candidate to assist in their preparation for the next stage.
Benefits: A one-time grant of Rs50,000/- per candidate is provided to support their preparation for the next stages of the examinations.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a native or permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The total family income should not exceed Rs5,00,000/- per annum from all sources.The applicant should have completed graduation/post-graduation from recognized institution (regular/open) located in Uttarakhand.The applicant should have passed the minimum eligibility criteria for these examinations.The applicant should not have availed benefits from any similar scheme of the state or central government.The applicant or their spouse should not be engaged in any job, business, or profession.The applicant should have passed:Preliminary exam of Group 'A' or 'B' conducted by the Uttarakhand Public Service Commission (UKPSC) (Top 100 candidates)Preliminary/written exam of Group 'A' or 'B' conducted by the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC)Written exams for Armed Forces: NDA, CDS, OTA, Indian Naval Academy, Indian Air Force Academy, etc.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The eligible applicants should visit (during office hours) the Directorate of Higher Education, Haldwani, and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.ORThe interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Directorate of Higher Education, Haldwani. Note: The application must be submitted within 3 months of result declaration.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar CardPAN CardBank Account Passbook (Aadhaar-linked)Permanent Residence CertificateIncome CertificateEducational Certificates (High School, Intermediate, Graduation, Post-Graduation or equivalent)Result and Admit Card of Preliminary Exam passed (UKPSC/UPSC)Certificate and Admit Card of the Written Exam passed (In case of Armed Forces)

Scheme_Name: ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship
Details: The Fellowship is aimed at promoting original, socially relevant, and policy-focused research in the social sciences. The fellowship provides financial support through a monthly grant of Rs20,000 and an annual contingency grant of Rs20,000 for up to two years, with an initial award period of one year, which is renewed for the second year subject to fulfilment of requisite criteria. It also offers institutional and short-term fellowships including a six-month short term fellowship for scholars nearing Ph.D. submission (minimum three years of completed PhD research) and a standalone contingency grant of Rs62,500 for specific research needs. Applications are invited through ICSSR's website and social media platforms. Fellows are expected to pursue full-time research, submit regular progress reports, and provide a final submission that includes published work, a book-length thesis, and audited financial records.  Given India's social science ecosystem, it seeks to promote research excellence, evidence-based research, and scholarship that is also relevant to policymakers.
Benefits: 1)	Monthly Fellowship amount @ Rs.20,000 per month2)	Contingency Grant @ Rs.20,000 per annum
Eligibility: 1)	Applicant must be an Indian citizen.2)	Must be a full-time bonafide Ph.D. scholar in a social science discipline in a UGC-recognized university, deemed-to-be university, institute of national importance, ICSSR Research Institute, or college with approved Ph.D. programme.3)	The Ph.D. topic must have been confirmed by the DRC/authorised statutory body of the institution on or before the last date of call for applications.4)	Age must be below 40 years as on the last date of application.5)	Age relaxation of 5 years allowed for SC/ST/OBC-(NCL) candidates and Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwD).6)	Must have secured a minimum of 55% marks in post-graduation, with 5% relaxation for reserved categories (SC/ST/OBC-(NCL)/PwD).
Application_Process: OnlineStep 01: Visit ICSSR website - www.icssr.org - and navigate to Fellowships section.Step 02: Click on Doctoral Fellowship Scheme.Step 03: Register/Login to the ICSSR portal.Step 04: Fill the online application form.Step 05: Upload documents and submit.
Documents_Required: The list of documents required will be given in the Application Form when the Call is announced.

Scheme_Name: Award Scheme for Candidates Selected in NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, IAF
Details: The scheme "Award Scheme for Candidates Selected in NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, IAF" was introduced by the Higher Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. This scheme aims to recognize and reward candidates from Uttarakhand who have been selected for service at premier defence academies such as NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, and IAF and are either undergoing training or have been formally inducted into service. Under this scheme, a one-time award of Rs50,000/- is given to each eligible candidate in recognition of their achievement and contribution to national service.
Benefits: One-time grant of Rs50,000/- per candidate. Note:The amount is disbursed every 6 months post-verification by the department.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The candidate should have been selected for service at one of the premier defence academies, such as National Defence Academy (NDA), Indian Military Academy (IMA), Officers Training Academy (OTA), Indian Naval Academy (INA) or Indian Air Force (IAF). The applicant should either be currently undergoing training at the respective academy or have been formally inducted into the defence service.The award is given only once under this scheme.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The applicant should apply after being selected for service and completing the training. Step 2: The eligible applicant should visit (during office hours) the Directorate of Higher Education, Haldwani, and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.ORThe interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 3: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 4: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Directorate of Higher Education, Haldwani.Note: Upon primary verification at the departmental level and post-approval, the amount is disbursed within six months.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar CardPAN CardBank Account details/PassbookDomicile CertificateAppointment LetterTraining Completion CertificateProof of Joining after TrainingSelf-declaration (stating that the benefit has not been claimed earlier under this scheme)

Scheme_Name: Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana
Details: The scheme "Atma Nirbhar Plantation Yojana (ANPY)" was launched by the Department of Agriculture, Government of Arunachal Pradesh, aims to promote self-reliance in the agriculture sector through sustainable plantation activities across the state's diverse agro-climatic zones. Under this scheme, support in the form of plantation assistance and allied resources is provided to individual farmers, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), and Farmer Producer Organizations (FPOs).
Benefits: Access to plantation support including technical guidance, planting material, and financial assistance.
Eligibility: The Scheme can be applied by individual farmers as well as Self-Help Groups (SHGs)/ Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs).Eligibility Criteria for Individual FarmersThe applicant should be a native of Arunachal Pradesh.The applicant should be an individual farmer. The applicant should have landholding between 0.50 hectares and 25 hectares.The applicant should not be a bank defaulter.The applicant should not be a government servant.Eligibility Criteria for Self-Help Groups (SHGs)The applicant should be a Self-Help Group (SHG) based in Arunachal Pradesh. The SHG should have a minimum of 1.0 hectare and up to 50 hectares of land.The SHG should not be a bank defaulter.An already existing SHGs prior to involvement of SrLM shall be considered.SHGs formed for small-scale industries such as weaving, knitting, tailoring, and other similar businesses shall not be entertained or considered eligible.Note: The SHGs formed especially for Agri- sector shall be given priority.Eligibility Criteria for Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs)The Farmer Producer Organization (FPO) should be registered in Arunachal Pradesh. The FPO should have a minimum of 5 hectares and a maximum of 50 hectares of land.The FPO should have at least 100 shareholders.The FPO should submit at least one audited Balance Sheet.All board members and shareholders of FPO should be non-defaulters to any bank/financial institution.All types of FPOs engaged in agriculture business will get benefit from this programme.
Application_Process: OnlineOfflineInterested and eligible students need to apply online on the Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal. New User RegistrationSelect the "Login" option.Subsequently, click on the "Register Here" link.Complete the registration form with the requisite details, including your name, Aadhaar card number, email ID, and mobile number.Establish a password for your account.Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a User ID and password.Login & Application Process:Log in using the provided User ID and password to access the application form.Fill in the complete application form.Upload the required documents, including a photograph, caste certificate, residential certificate, and land ownership proof, etc.Submit the application form.
Documents_Required: Passport-size PhotographAadhaar CardPAN CardST CertificateDomicile Certificate/Permanent Resident Certificate (PRC)SHG/FPO Document Proof of Land Ownership Document (LPC/ any Land Documents duly Certified by HGB/GB/PRI and countersigned by the local administration)Certified Copy of the Sketch MapPhotocopy of 1st page of Bank Passbook One audited Balance Sheet (For FPO)Any Other Document if Required

Scheme_Name: Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme
Details: "Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme" is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide interest-free loans for higher education and overseas studies to the minority students.
Benefits: Interest-free loans of up to Rs5,00,000/- for pursuing higher education and studies abroadNote: The beneficiary will have to repay the loan in the next 3 years after completing 6 months of education/ service.
Eligibility: Beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.Beneficiary should belong to the minority community.The age of the beneficiary should be between 18-35 years of age.Beneficiary should have passed Higher Secondary (12th Class).The University/College/Institution, where the student is studying/ enrolled, should be recognized by the Central/ State Government or any other competent authority.The income of the beneficiary's family from all sources should not exceed Rs2,50,000/-.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: Applicants should visit their nearest District Office or office of the Minorities Welfare Officer and collect application form.Step 2:  Fill the form properly and attach all the documents (attested,if required).Step 3: Submit the form latest by 31st August of the concerned year at the District Office or the office of the Minorities Welfare Officer.
Documents_Required: For the Applicant:Colour Photograph,Aadhaar Card,Permanent Residence Certificate,Minority Proof  Certificate,Proof of Birth. Marksheet of last year,College/Institution Admission Certificate,Fee structure,College ID,Nationalised Bank Passbook, Affidavit to the effect that the loan scheme is being availed of for the first time.For the 2(two) Guarantors:Salary/Income Certificate,PAN card,Photographs, Aadhaar Card,Ration Card,Status Certificate Report.

Scheme_Name: Mahila Adhikarita Yojana (Gujarat Safai Kamdar Development Corporation)
Details: "Mahila Adhikarita Yojana" introduced by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, is a centrally sponsored financial support scheme targeting women sweepers and their dependents. Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries are provided a loan of Rs20,000 at a low interest rate of 5%, with a repayment period of 5 years. This initiative aims to empower women engaged in sanitation work by providing them with the financial means to pursue economic activities and improve their quality of life. The scheme is being implemented by the Gujarat Safai Kamdar Development Corporation.
Benefits: Loan Assistance: An amount of Rs20,000/- at 5% interest rate, with a repayment period of 5 years.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a woman sweeper or a dependent of a woman sweeper.The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
Application_Process: OnlineRegistration Process:Step 1: Go to the  eSamajKalyan portal and navigate to the "Gujarat Safai Kamdar Development Corporation" section under the Corporation menu.Step 2: Click on "Mahila Adhikarita Yojana" and then Apply Now.Step 3: Click on "New User? Please Register Here".Step 4: Enter the required details and click Register.Application Process:Step 1: Enter your User ID, Password, and Captcha Code, then click "Login".Step 2: Read the scheme details carefully and click OK.Step 3: If your permanent address is correct, confirm it. Otherwise, enter your correct address.Step 4: Click Save & Next to proceed. Upload the relevant documents.Step 5: If you need to make changes, click "No, Cancel". If all details are correct, click "Yes, Submit".Step 6: Click Save Application. Note down your Application Number for future reference. You can also take a printout by clicking Print Application.Check Application Status: Click here.
Documents_Required: Proof of Residence (any one of Electricity Bill/Licence/Lease Agreement/Electoral Card/Ration Card).Guarantee Sheet.Disability Certificate (If applicable).Specimen of Applicant's Gross Annual Income (Certificate from Competent Authority).Ration Card (to upload both pages with name and number of ration card applicant).Certificate regarding being a sweeper/ dependent of a sweeper.Aadhaar Card.BPL Certificate.Certificate of death of husband.Copy of passbook page showing bank account details or canceled cheque.Election Card.

Scheme_Name: Uttarakhand State Shilp Ratna Award
Details: The scheme "Uttarakhand State Shilp Ratna Award" is implemented by the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to honor exceptionally skilled artisans of the state for their outstanding contributions to the traditional craft sector. This annual award celebrates heritage, promotes excellence, and supports artisans whose expertise has preserved and enriched cultural craftsmanship.
Benefits: Award Details:A cash prize of Rs1,00,000/-.A memento (symbolic representation).An angavastra (ceremonial stole).A certificate of appreciation.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be a skilled artisan. The applicant should be 45 years of age or above.The applicant should be proficient in traditional or extraordinary art forms and have made significant contributions.The artisans should have contributed to the training of young artisans in the district.The applicant should have a minimum of 15 years of experience in a recognized traditional craft.The applicant should not be employed in government/semi-government/cooperative institutions.Note: Preference will be given to artisans who have received national/state-level awards.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the General Manager, District Industries Centre and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.ORThe interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website link:https://investuttarakhand.uk.gov.inhttps://doi.uk.gov.in/Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the General Manager, District Industries Centre.Post-application Process:Step 1: The application is reviewed by a District-Level Committee chaired by the District Magistrate.Step 2: Shortlisted applications are forwarded to the State-Level Selection Committee, chaired by the Principal Secretary, MSME Department.Step 3: Final awardees are selected based on merit and recommendations.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar CardProof of Age (Birth Certificate or equivalent documents)Permanent Residence CertificateDetails of the Guru/Teacher from whom craft was learnedEducational/Vocational Qualifications (if applicable)Details of contributions to the craftProof of purchase of craft productsRecords of youth training provided by the artisanList of exhibitions/fairs participated inIncome certificateAny awards or recognition receivedPhotos of crafted products (preferably bought by institutions)

Scheme_Name: Palak Mata-Pita Yojana
Details: The "Palak Mata-Pita Yojana" introduced on 29th August, 2009 by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, aims to provide monthly assistance of Rs. 3000/- is paid to the close relative, guardian or relative who is taking care of the orphaned children who are studying and whose mother and father are both deceased or whose father is deceased and the mother has remarried. This assistance is paid through DBT.
Benefits: Financial Assistance: Rs3,000/- per month.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a close relative, guardian, or foster parent taking care of the child.The applicant must be caring for a child aged between 0 to 18 years.The applicant must be taking care of a child whose both parents are deceased, or whose father is deceased and mother has remarried.The applicant must ensure that the child between 3 to 6 years is enrolled in an Anganwadi center.The applicant must ensure that the child above 6 years is enrolled in a school for compulsory education.The applicant must submit a certificate from the school or institution every year confirming the child's ongoing education.The applicant must have an annual family income not exceeding Rs27,000/- in rural areas.The applicant must have an annual family income not exceeding Rs36,000/- in urban areas.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: Go to the  eSamajKalyan portal and Register/Login.Step 2: Fill in the online application form under "Palak Mata-Pita Yojana".Step 3: Upload the required documents and Submit the application.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar Card.Age Proof.Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.Birth Certificate.Children's Aadhar Card.Death Certificate.Income Certificate.Ration Card.School Leaving Certificate.Self Declaration (in Original).
Search_Keywords: Palak Mata-Pita Yojana, pmpy, Child Welfare, Financial Assistance, Foster Parent, Orphan, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Atma Nirbhar Pashu Palan Yojana
Details: The scheme "Atma Nirbhar Pashu Palan Yojna (ANPPY)", implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry, Veterinary & Dairy Development, Government of Arunachal Pradesh, aims to enhance rural livelihoods, promote sustainable animal husbandry practices, and contribute to self-reliance in the livestock sector. Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of credit-linked support is provided to unemployed individuals, Self-Help Groups (SHGs), farmers' clubs, cooperative societies, and Dairy Cooperative Societies (DCS) for livestock rearing and allied activities.
Benefits: Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of credit-linked support is provided to eligible beneficiaries for livestock rearing and allied activities.
Eligibility: The following beneficiaries are eligible under this scheme:Arunachal State Rural Livelihoods Mission (ArSRLM) promoted Self-Help Groups (SHGs), individuals, Farmers' Clubs, Registered Cooperative Societies, and Dairy Cooperative Societies (DCS) will be eligible.Individuals should belong to the Arunachal Pradesh Scheduled Tribe (APST) category and be unemployed.
Application_Process: OnlineInterested and eligible students need to apply online on the Atma Nirbhar Yojana portal. New User RegistrationSelect the "Login" option.Subsequently, click on the "Register Here" link.Complete the registration form with the requisite details, including your name, Aadhaar card number, email ID, and mobile number.Establish a password for your account.Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a User ID and password.Login & Application Process:Log in using the provided User ID and password to access the application form.Fill in the complete application form.Upload the required documents, including a photograph, caste certificate, residential certificate, and land ownership proof, etc.Submit the application form.
Documents_Required: ST CertificateDomicile Certificate/Permanent Resident Certificate (PRC)Photocopy of 1st page of Bank Passbook Any other document if required

Scheme_Name: Hostel Rent Assistance Scheme for Tribal Students
Details: The scheme "Hostel Rent Assistance Scheme for Tribal Students" was introduced by the Tribal Area Development Department, Government of Rajasthan, aims to encourage tribal students (both boys and girls) of Rajasthan to pursue higher education in undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Under this scheme, hostel rent assistance is provided for a maximum period of five years to Scheduled Tribe students studying in government colleges who reside in rented accommodation for the purpose of regular studies. The scheme is applicable only to students from Scheduled Areas of Rajasthan enrolled in government colleges.
Benefits: Students receive the following rental assistance as a cash benefit:Sl. NoLocationDurationRate per month per student (Rs)Amount (for 10 months) (Rs)1Divisional HeadquartersUp to 10 months50050002District HeadquartersUp to 10 months40040003Other AreasUp to 10 months3003000Mode of Disbursement:The amount is transferred directly to the beneficiary's bank account linked with the Bhamashah card.Validity of Benefit:Up to a maximum of 5 academic years per student.
Eligibility: The applicant should be studying regularly a undergraduate or postgraduate course in a government college.The student should belong to a Scheduled Tribe community residing in the Scheduled Areas of Rajasthan. Scheme_Name: Chief Minister's Higher Education Research Promotion Scheme
Details: The scheme "Chief Minister's Higher Education Research Promotion Scheme" was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote high-quality, interdisciplinary research in higher education institutions across the state. Under this scheme, a one-time research grant of up to Rs15,00,000 is provided, which may be extended to Rs18,00,000 in special cases. Additionally, a monthly stipend of Rs5,000 is offered for research assistants.The broad subject areas eligible for research include Science, Arts and Humanities, Home Science, Commerce, and Management. However, interdisciplinary research proposals are also encouraged. Priority will be given to research proposals focusing on specific problems and those falling under the Problem and Action-Based Research Programme.
Benefits: One-Time Research Grant:Up to Rs15,00,000/- per project, extendable to Rs18,00,000/- in special circumstances.Monthly Stipend:Rs5,000/- per month for research assistants from the start to the completion of the research.Disbursement Details:Mode: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the institution's Research & Development cell.Frequency: In three installments - 50% upon approval, 30% after submission of the utilization certificate, and 20% upon completion of the research.Validity: Funds must be utilized within the approved research timeline.Note 1: Research must be original and align with UGC standards.Note 2: The research duration is up to 2 years, extendable by 1 year in special cases.Note 3: Only one research project is permissible per researcher at a time.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be a regular faculty member, student, or research scholar in government colleges or state university campuses.Research proposals should fall under Science, Arts and Humanities, Home Science, Commerce, Management, or interdisciplinary areas.Research proposals related to Uttarakhand that demonstrate productivity and utility in social, economic, contemporary, or other areas of special importance will be encouraged.Priority will be given to proposals that focus on specific problems and fall under the Problem and Action-Based Research Programme.Research proposals may also be invited based on specific requests from state government departments.Note: A co-research investigator can also be included along with the principal research investigator in the research proposal.
Application_Process: OnlineThe applicant submits the research proposal along with the required documents.New User RegistrationRegister and apply online through the Samarth Portal: https://uttarakhand.samarth.ac.in/index.php/site/loginComplete the registration form with the requisite details, including your name, Aadhaar card number, email ID, and mobile number.Establish a password for your account.Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a User ID and password.Login & Application Process:Log in using the provided User ID and password to access the application form.Fill in the complete application form.Upload the required documents, including a photograph, caste certificate, residential certificate, land ownership proof, etc.Submit the application form. Post-application Process:The application must be forwarded by the institution's principal or registrar within 15 days; otherwise, it will auto-forward to the next level.An evaluation committee will assess the proposal.Upon approval, funds will be disbursed in three installments as per the disbursement details.
Documents_Required: Aadhaar CardPAN CardBank Account DetailsPermanent Residence CertificateAppointment Letter (for faculty)Enrollment Certificate (for students/research scholars)Research ProposalDeclaration stating non-receipt of similar benefits previously
Search_Keywords: Chief Minister's Higher Education Research Promotion Scheme, cmherps, Higher Education, Research, Research Grant, Research Scholar, Stipend, Student, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Assistance Program for the Cultivation of Lotus Fruit (Dragon Fruit)
Details: The scheme "Assistance Program for the Cultivation of Lotus Fruit (Dragon Fruit)" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to promote horticultural farming by supporting farmers with financial aid for the initial infrastructure and planting costs involved in dragon fruit cultivation.
Benefits: General category: 50% assistance or up to Rs3,00,000/- per hectare (whichever is less).SC/ST category:  75% assistance or up to Rs4,50,000/- per hectare (whichever is less).First Year Assistance:Cement pole/pipe: 1111 units at Rs300 each = Rs3,33,300/-Planting material: 4444 units at Rs35 each = Rs1,55,540/-Total: Rs4,88,840/-Actual Assistance Provided: 50% or up to Rs2,44,420/-, whichever is less.Second Year Assistance:Head ring or Trellising & wire (approx. 400 kg): Rs1,11,160/-Actual Assistance Provided: 50% or up to Rs55,580/-, whichever is less.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer.The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant must have a minimum land between 0.20 ha and 1 ha.The applicant must procure quality planting materials from a nursery and start the plantation.Note: Preference will be given to small-scale and women farmers.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Step 2: On the home page, click on 'Schemes' and then click on 'Agricultural Schemes'.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the 'Apply' button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
Documents_Required: 7/12 Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.

Scheme_Name: Family Pension for the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB)
Details: "Family Pension for the Construction Workers'' is a social security scheme implemented by the Uttarakhand Bhavan and other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, the spouse of the registered worker, who is a pensioner, will get a monthly pension of Rs500/- per month or 50% of the pensioner's pension whichever is higher in case of death of the construction worker.
Benefits: The spouse of the registered worker, who is a pensioner, will get a monthly pension of Rs500/- per month or 50% of the pensioner's pension whichever is higher in case of death of the construction worker.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should be the spouse of the registered worker who has lost his/her life due to death. The worker should have been registered under the Uttarakhand Bhavan and other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsFor New Registration under the UKBOCWWB:Step 1: To become a beneficiary, a construction worker who has completed 18 years of age and has not completed 60 years, has worked as a construction worker for at least 90 days during the preceding 1 year, can register himself/herself.Step 2: The eligible worker may visit the nearest Jan Seva Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents for online registration.Step 3: Upon successful registration, the applicant will receive a Registration Number for future reference.Step 4: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSearch-hi.aspxNote 1: After verification of the application, the photo identity card will be issued by the registration officer.Note 2: Registration will be done free of cost, which will be valid for three years and after the completion of three years, only Rs100/- contribution will be required to be deposited by the construction worker for every next three years.Application Process for Welfare Scheme Benefits:Step 1: To avail the benefits of the scheme, the eligible applicant may visit the nearest Shram Suvidha Kendra along with all the relevant documents.Step 2: Upon successful submission of the application form, the applicant will receive an Application Number for future reference.Step 3: The applicant can also track the status of their application online by visiting the official website: https://ukbocw.uk.gov.in/DynamicPages/LabourSchemeSearch.aspx
Documents_Required: For New/Renewal Labour Card:Passport Photocopies (2)Birth Proof (10th Certificate/Birth Certificate/Certificate from a Medical Officer/Notary Certified Self Declaration of the construction worker/Voter ID/Ration Card/Certificate issued by the Panchayat Officer, Gram Pradhan or counsellor.A certificate of employment as a construction worker for at least 90 days in the previous year.A nomination form by the construction worker for the nomination of his legal heirs.Aadhaar card,Ration card,Bank account with Aadhaar linked/seeded,Self-certification/self-declaration form (which can be obtained at Jan Suvidha Kendra or Shramik Suvidha Kendra only)Dependent's Aadhaar card.For Scheme Application:Letter of Application,Labour Card,Bank account details,Self-declaration certificate,Handwritten certificate stating that they have not received any assistance or in this regard no application has been made in any other department.
Search_Keywords: Family Pension for the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB), fpftcw, Construction Workers, Family Pension, Financial Assistance, Labour, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Construction of Water Storage Tanks for Drip Irrigation
Details: The scheme "Construction of Water Storage Tanks for Drip Irrigation" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat,  aims to offer financial assistance to farmers for setting up cemented water tanks essential for efficient drip irrigation.  It supports sustainable agriculture through water conservation, especially for horticultural practices.
Benefits: Unit cost of construction: Rs1,00,000/- per tank.For General category farmers: 50% subsidy, up to Rs50,000/-.For SC/ST farmers: 75% subsidy, up to Rs75,000/-.
Eligibility: The applicant must be a farmer. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.The applicant must plan to construct a cemented water storage tank of at least 25.50 cubic meters capacity.Note: Cemented mature water tanks, drip set mandatory.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Step 2: On the home page, click on 'Schemes' and then click on 'Agricultural Schemes'.Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the 'Apply' button and an application page will open.Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application.Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application.Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it.Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application.Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx Contact Us: Click here.
Documents_Required: 7/12 Certificate.Aadhaar Card.Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.Note: For reasonableness of the cost of the tank, a certificate regarding the cost of the tank from the Government Valuer/Taluka Surveyor/ MNREGA surveyor will have to be provided by the beneficiary.

Scheme_Name: Antyeshthi Sahay Yojana
Details: The  "Antyeshthi Sahay Yojana" is a welfare scheme by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department of Gujarat. The scheme aims to support the families of deceased senior citizens who were beneficiaries of old age assistance. Upon the death of such a senior citizen, a one-time financial aid of Rs5,000/- is given to the legal heir to help cover funeral and related expenses.
Benefits: Financial Assistance: A one-time assistance of Rs5,000/-.
Eligibility: The applicant must be the heir of a deceased senior citizen.The deceased must have been a beneficiary of old age assistance.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit the Mamlatdar office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form.Step 2: In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Mamlatdar office.Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted.
Documents_Required: Old age assistance sanction order/online registered pension number or bank account number where pension is deposited.Death Certificate.Copy of Ration Card.Copy of the applicant's Bank Passbook.Applicant's Aadhaar Number.Consent Form of all the heirs (In case there is more than one heir).
Search_Keywords: Antyeshthi Sahay Yojana, asygsw, Death Aid, Funeral Assistance, Senior Citizen, Social Welfare, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Nikshay Poshan Yojana
Details: The "Nikshay Poshan Yojana", launched in 2018 by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, provides financial assistance of Rs1,000/- per month to each notified tuberculosis (TB) patient for nutritional support. All TB patients notified on or after 1st April 2018 and registered on the NIKSHAY portal are eligible. The scheme aims to improve treatment outcomes by addressing malnutrition and supporting patients throughout their treatment.
Benefits: Financial Incentive: An amount of Rs1,000/- per month for each notified TB patient.
Eligibility: All patients with tuberculosis (TB) who are notified to the government on or after April 1, 2018, including those who are already being treated for TB, are eligible for financial incentives.To be eligible for the incentives, patients must be registered or notified on the NIKSHAY portal.
Application_Process: OnlineSubmission of Bank Account DetailsPatient need to submit his/her Aadhaar-linked savings bank account to TB health provider.Supporting documents like a Aadhaar number, passbook, canceled cheque, or bank statement must be collected.If Patient don't have a bank account:Open a new account (e.g., via Jan Dhan Yojana/India Post Payments Bank).Alternatively, Patient may nominate a family member's account with a written consent (standard format available in the manual).Registration in NikshayPatient bank details will be entered by the TB health staff into the Nikshay system.Ensure Patient account is unique--no two beneficiaries can use the same bank account.Nikshay will automatically send the bank details to PFMS for validation.Bank Account Validation via PFMSOnce validated:A PFMS Beneficiary ID is assigned.Patient status in Nikshay changes to "Validated".If rejected:Patient will receive an SMS asking his/her to contact the health staff to correct the bank details.
Documents_Required: Bank Account ProofPhotocopy of bank passbook (showing account holder name, account number, and IFSC)Cancelled chequeRecent bank statement.Note: The account must be a savings bank account, active, and preferably Aadhaar-linked.Aadhaar Document (Optional but Recommended)Copy of Aadhaar Card (if available)If Aadhaar is not available, you should:Apply for Aadhaar and submit a copy of the acknowledgement receiptConsent/Declaration Form (Only in specific cases)If you wish to receive benefits in a family member's bank account:A written consent/authorization form is required (format provided in the annexure of the manual).If you refuse to receive DBT benefits:A signed declaration to forego benefits must be submitted.

Scheme_Name: Operation of Sports Hostels
Details: The scheme "Operation of Sports Hostels" was introduced by the Tribal Area Development Department, Government of Rajasthan. It aims to encourage tribal students in Scheduled Areas to participate in sports and prepare them for national and international competitions. Under this scheme, tribal students from Class 6 to 12 are provided with free residential facilities, training in archery and athletics by skilled coaches, nutritious meals, uniforms, and modern sports equipment. The scheme is implemented in the following District:	Banswara, Dungarpur, Sirohi, Udaipur & Pratapgarh.
Benefits: The following facilities are provided in the sports hostel:Free residential accommodation in sports hostels.Nutritious meals, snacks, and special dietary arrangements as per approved pattern.Sports training with modern equipment by expert coaches (especially in archery and athletics).Free school uniforms and educational materials.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan.The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe community.The applicant should be studying in class 6th to 12th.The applicant should not have any disability or suffering from any serious illness.The applicant's parents/guardians should not be income tax payers.The applicant should not be a failed student in the last examination.Note: Only those students who pass the selection test will be admitted to the sports hostel.
Application_Process: Online - via CSCsStep 1: The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme.Step 2: The applicant should visit the nearest E-Mitra Center and complete the Biometric Verification Process.Step 3: The applicant should ensure that the E-Mitra Center agent completes all mandatory fields in the application form and uploads copies of all required documents.Step 4: Keep the acknowledgment receipt for future reference.
Documents_Required: Aadhar Card CopyJan Aadhar/Bhamashah Card CopyEducation Qualification Marksheet/Certificate Copy (Last Class Marksheet)Caste/Tribe CertificateIncome Certificate
Search_Keywords: Operation of Sports Hostels, osh, Hostel, Scheduled Tribe, Sports, Sports Training, Tribal Students, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Skill Development
Details: The scheme "Skill Development" implemented by the Wadia Institute of Himalayan Geology aims to enhance the practical knowledge and research capabilities of students pursuing Earth Science and allied subjects. Through this scheme, specialised summer and winter training programmes are offered to postgraduate and integrated postgraduate students in disciplines such as geochemistry, sedimentology, tectonics, geomorphology, environmental geoscience, and paleontology.
Benefits: Research Experience: Provides opportunities for self-sponsored research work, allowing students to gain practical experience in Earth Sciences.Seasonal Training: Offers valuable summer and winter training programs, enhancing practical skills and knowledge in specialized geological disciplines.Exposure to Diverse Fields: Exposes students to a wide array of sub-disciplines within Earth Sciences, such as structural geology, geochemistry, glaciology, engineering geology, palaeontology, and environmental geology.
Eligibility: The applicant must possess a postgraduate degree in any discipline of Geosciences, Earth Sciences, or allied fields.The applicant may also be pursuing an integrated postgraduate degree course and should be in the fourth or fifth year of the curriculum.The applicant must be from fields such as geophysics, geochemistry, structural geology, sedimentology, paleontology, environmental geoscience, and related disciplines.
Application_Process: OnlineStep 1: Visit the official website of WIHG at https://www.wihg.res.in./.Step 2: Look for announcements or notifications regarding the Kaushal Vikas (Skill Development) programme.Step 3: Download or access the application form or online registration link.Step 4: Fill out the form with all required personal, academic, and institutional details.Step 5: Upload or attach the required documents as specified in the guidelines.Step 6: Submit the application as per instructions.
Documents_Required: Postgraduate Degree Certificate or Provisional Certificate.Bonafide Certificate from the Institution (for currently enrolled students).Academic Marksheet.Identity Proof (Aadhaar Card/Passport/Voter ID).Any other document s required.
Search_Keywords: Skill Development, sduk, Earth Science, Education, Geoscience, Postgraduate Research, Skill Development, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Fish Farming Diversification (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe) Scheme
Details: The scheme "Fish Farming Diversification (Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe) Scheme" was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sustainable livelihoods for Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe communities through fishery-based diversified activities. Under this scheme, a 60% subsidy is provided to eligible fish farmers for pond renovation, integrated fish farming (duck/poultry/fruit plantation), and mobile fish stalls to support fish processing and marketing.
Benefits: Pond Renovation:Rs42,000/- subsidy (60%) for 100 sq. meter pond (total cost: Rs70,000/-).Rs3,00,000/- subsidy (60%) for 1.0 hectare pond in plain areas (total cost: Rs5,00,000/-).Note: Fish farmers who already have a pond and are involved in fish/poultry farming and other integrated activities receive a 60% subsidy.Integrated Farming Unit:Rs83,000/- subsidy (60%) for 1 unit in hilly areas (total cost: Rs1,39,000/-).Rs3,96,000/- subsidy (60%) for 1 unit in plain areas (total cost: Rs6,60,000/-).Mobile Fish Stall:Rs1,50,000/- subsidy (60%) against Rs2,50,000/- cost for landless individuals for fish marketing.Mode of Disbursement:Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the beneficiary's bank account.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a native of Uttarakhand.The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe community.The applicant should be engaged in fish production and possess a pond or be landless and interested in engaging in fish processing or marketing businesses to be eligible.
Application_Process: OfflineOnlineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the district-level office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries Officer and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the district-level office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries Officer.Post-application Process:Step 1: A field survey is conducted by fisheries inspectors in coordination with the applicant.Step 2: A proposal is prepared and approved by the concerned district-level officer.Step 3: The applicant executes the work (pond renovation, integrated unit, or mobile stall) under field staff guidance.Step 4: Upon completion, a work completion certificate is issued.Step 5: The subsidy amount (60% of the approved cost) is credited to the applicant's bank account via DBT.
Documents_Required: Applicant PhotoAadhaar CardLand Documents (Khasra Khatauni of land for pond owners)Permanent Residence CertificateCaste Certificate Bank Account DetailsMobile NumberPond Details (for those with existing ponds)Photo of SiteNOTE: For landless applicants: Pond details and land documents not required.
Search_Keywords: Fish Farming Diversification (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe) Scheme, ffds, Fish Farmer, Fish Farming, Poultry Farming, Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe, Subsidy, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Construction of Ideal Fish Pond Scheme in Hilly Areas
Details: The Scheme "Construction of Ideal Fish Pond Scheme in Hilly Areas" was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote sustainable fish production by utilizing water resources effectively in hilly regions through cluster-based pond development. Under this scheme, financial support of up to 50% of the cost is provided for the construction of ponds and first-year investments such as fish fingerlings and feed to all caste categories in hilly areas. It also includes free technical assistance, optional free training, and marketing support through departmental platforms like Uttarafish.
Benefits: Subsidy for Pond Construction:Individual beneficiaries: Up to Rs2,50,000/- for pond capacity up to 500 cubic meters.Committee/Group/Mahasandh/Federation/Mangal Dal: Up to Rs5,00,000/- for pond capacity up to 1,000 cubic meters.Subsidy for First-Year Inputs:50% subsidy for purchasing fish fingerlings and feed.Technical Assistance:Free technical guidance for high-growth fish species.Optional free training in fishery operations.Marketing Support:Option to sell fish independently or via "Uttarafish", a state-supported fish marketing platform.Cluster Requirement:A minimum of 10 ponds must be constructed in one location, either by an individual or by a group.Self-Financing/Loan ProvisionThe remaining 50% investment is to be made by the beneficiary through personal funds or bank loans.NOTE: The subsidy is paid to the beneficiary's account through DBT.Applicants can avail grants either individually or through registered groups and cooperatives, with additional funding covered through self-investment or bank loans.
Eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant should belong to any caste category and reside in a hilly region of the state.The applicant should be involved in fish production or be interested in starting it.The applicant should have access to a reliable water supply source.The applicant should have own land or leased land for construction of fish pond.The applicant can apply individually or as part of a committee, group, cooperative, federation, or Mangal Dal.The applicant should ensure the construction of a minimum of 10 ponds at one place(either individually or jointly).
Application_Process: OfflineOnlineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-Charge at the district level and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Assistant Director Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level.Post-application Process:Step 1: A fisheries inspector/field officer conducts a site survey and prepares a proposal in collaboration with the applicant.Step 2: The proposal is reviewed and approved by the concerned district fisheries officer.Step 3: Pond construction is carried out under the supervision of field personnel. Technical assistance is provided throughout.Step 4: On completion, based on the work completion certificate, the subsidy is released via DBT. In case of loans, subsidy is disbursed through the bank.Note:If the applicant lacks 50% of the required funds, a loan can be availed from nearby cooperative or commercial banks. Department-provided proposals are submitted to the bank for loan approval.
Documents_Required: Applicant PhotoAadhaar CardPermanent Residence CertificateCaste CertificateKhasra-Khatauni of Land (Land Ownership Document)Bank Account Details/Copy of Front Page of Bank PassbookMobile NumberPhoto Of construction SiteGroup Registration Certificate (in case of group application)Land Availability Certificate (if land is not owned by the applicant but is accessible)
Search_Keywords: Construction of Ideal Fish Pond Scheme in Hilly Areas, ifpcsiha, Financial Assistance, Fish Farming, Hilly Areas, Pond, Pond Construction, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Mukhyamantri Chhatravritti Yojana
Details: The scheme "Mukhyamantri Chhatravritti Yojana" by the Department of Education, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to support eligible NCC cadets through financial incentives to encourage continued participation in education and NCC training. Through this scheme, scholarship amounts ranging from Rs600/- to Rs2,400/- are provided annually to eligible NCC cadets at group and unit levels. Annual cash scholarships are awarded at both group and unit levels to junior and senior division NCC cadets. The scheme is implemented by designated Group Headquarters and Unit Offices under the administrative control of the State Directorate of NCC.
Benefits: Group Level:For Senior Division/Senior Wing cadets: Rs2,400/-.For Junior Division/Junior Wing cadets: Rs1,200/-.Unit Level:For Senior Division/Senior Wing cadets: Rs1,200/-.For Junior Division/Junior Wing cadets: Rs600/-.
Eligibility: The applicant must be an NCC cadet.The applicant must have passed the 10th or 12th class or an equivalent examination in the previous academic session.The applicant must have completed two years of NCC training.The applicant must have maintained a minimum of 80% attendance in each year of NCC training.The applicant must be currently pursuing higher education.The applicant must not be receiving any other general or special scholarship from the State Government.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The Group Headquarters/Units collect applications in the prescribed format from cadets of schools/colleges where NCC is functional.Step 2: Each Group Headquarters constitutes a "Board of Officers" to review and verify applications.Step 3: The board also handles the processing of cadets' application forms and all related documents.Step 4: The complete application set, including the filled form and caste certificate certified by the competent authority, is submitted to the Directorate.Step 5: Upon approval at the Directorate level, the scholarship amount is sanctioned and disbursed.
Documents_Required: Fully Filled Application Form.Caste Certificate (Issued by the competent authority).Any other documents as required.
Search_Keywords: Mukhyamantri Chhatravritti Yojana, mcyuk, Higher Education, NCC, Scholarship, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Stand-Up India
Details: A scheme by Ministry of Finance for financing SC/ST and/or Women Entrepreneurs by facilitating bank loans for setting up a greenfield project  enterprise in manufacturing, services, trading sector and activities allied to agriculture. The objective of this scheme is to facilitate bank loans between Rs. 10 lakh and Rs. 1 Crore to at least one Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) borrower and at least one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up a greenfield enterprise. In case of non-individual enterprises, at least 51% of the shareholding and controlling stake should be held by either an SC/ST or Woman entrepreneur.
Benefits: Facilitation of composite loan (inclusive of term loan and working capital) between Rs10 Lakhs and Rs100 Lakhs. Rupay debit card to be issued for convenience of the borrower.The web portal by SIDBI provides hand-holding support through a network of agencies engaged in training, skill development, mentoring, project report preparation, application filling, work shed / utility support services, subsidy schemes etc.
Eligibility: Finance is  provided for Greenfield Enterprises.If the applicant is a male, he must be from SC / ST category.The age of the applicant must be at least 18 years.The applicant must not be in default to any bank/financial institution.
Application_Process: OnlineEither approach your nearest bank branch to apply (locate your nearest bank here - https://www.rbi.org.in/Scripts/query.aspx )Or Through the Lead District Manager (LDM) (find the address and the email of the LDM of your district here - https://www.standupmitra.in/LDMS#NoBack)Or Apply Through Portal: www.standupmitra.inProcess:The first step is to visit the official portal of StandUp India at: https://www.standupmitra.in/Login/Register Enter the full details of the business location.Select the category between SC, ST, Woman, and whether the stake held is 51% or higher.Select the nature of the proposed business; the loan amount desired description of the business, the details of the premises, etc.Populate the fields with past business experience, including tenure.Select the need for hand-holding is required.Enter all the personal details sought, which include the name of the enterprise and the constitution.The last step is to select the register button to complete the process.Once you have completed registration, you are eligible to initiate the StandUp India Loan Application process with the respective financial institution for the officials to contact you for completing the StandUp India Loan Process and requisite formalities.
Documents_Required: Proof of Identity: Voter's ID Card / Passport / Driving License / PAN Card / Signature identification from present bankers of proprietor, partner of director ( if a company)Proof of Residence: Recent telephone bills, electricity bill, property tax receipt /Passport / voter's ID Card of Proprietor, partner of Director (if a company)Proof of Business AddressProof that the applicant is not a defaulter in any Bank / Financial InstitutionMemorandum and articles of association of the Company / Partnership Deed of partners etc.Assets and liabilities statement of promoters and guarantors along with latest income tax returns.Rent Agreement (if business premises on rent) and clearance from pollution control board if applicable.SSI / MSME registration (if applicable)Projected balance sheets for the next two years in case of working capital limits and for the period of the loan in case of term loan.Photocopies of lease deeds/ title deeds of all the properties being offered as primary and collateral securities.Documents to establish whether the applicant belongs to SC/ST Category, wherever applicable.Certificate of incorporation from ROC to establish whether majority stake holding in the company is in the hands of a person who belongs to SC/ST/Woman category.For cases with exposure above Rs 25 Lakhs:Profile of the unit (includes names of promoters, other directors in the company, the activity being undertaken addresses of all offices and plants, shareholding pattern etc.Last three years balance sheets of the Associate / Group Companies (if any).Project report (for the proposed project if term funding is required) containing details of the machinery to be acquired, from whom to be acquired, price, names of suppliers, financial details like capacity of machines, capacity of utilization assumed, production, sales, projected profit and loss and balance sheets for the tenor of the loan, the details of labour, staff to be hired, basis of assumption of such financial details etc.Manufacturing process if applicable, major profile of executives in the company, any tie-ups, details about raw material used and their suppliers, details about the buyers, details about major-competitors and the company's strength and weaknesses as compared to their competitors etc.

Scheme_Name: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Disabled)
Details: The "Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Disabled)" scheme was launched by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to empower persons with disabilities by providing financial assistance for sustainable self-employment and livelihood generation. Under this scheme, the beneficiaries are supported with a mix of grants, subsidized loans, and margin money for term loans, shop construction, and bank-linked enterprises.
Benefits: Term Loan Scheme:Project Cost: Rs75,000/-Grant: 20% or Rs10,000/-, whichever is lessTerm Loan: Rs65,000/- at 6% annual interest rateShop Construction Scheme:Project Cost: Rs50,000/-Grant: 20% or Rs10,000/-, whichever is lessMargin Money Loan: Rs40,000/- at 4% annual interest rate, repayable in 60 monthly installmentsMargin Money Loan Scheme for Bank Supported Loan:Project Cost: Up to Rs2,00,000/-Grant: 20%, maximum of Rs10,000/-Margin Money: 25% of the project cost at 4% annual interest rate, repayable in 36 monthly installments
Eligibility: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.The applicant must possess a minimum of 40% disability. The applicant's annual family income must not exceed Rs2,00,000 in urban areas and Rs1,60,000/- in rural areas.The applicant's age must be between 18 and 50 years.
Application_Process: OfflineApplication Process:Step 1: The interested applicant downloads the application form from the official website. Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Vikas Khand (Block Development) Office. Selection Process:Step 1: The application will be forwarded to the District Social Welfare Officer.Step 2: A District-Level Committee, headed by the District Social Welfare Officer, will review the proposals and select beneficiaries.
Documents_Required: Passport-size Photograph.Voter ID.Aadhaar Card.Disability Certificate.Caste Certificate (If applicable).Any Other Document if Required.
Search_Keywords: Livelihood Opportunity Promotion Scheme (Disabled), lopsd, Financial Assistance, Loan, Margin Money, Person With Disability, Self-employment, Shop, myScheme, Government Schemes, Government Scheme, GovernmentScheme, GovernmentSchemes, Find Government Scheme, Gov Scheme Platform, Gov Scheme

Scheme_Name: Accessibility Services to Disabled People
Details: The scheme "Accessibility Services to Disabled People" is a central sector scheme that aims to support visually impaired and low vision individuals by registering them and facilitating suitable employment opportunities. Through this scheme, beneficiaries are helped in securing jobs in both the public and private sectors across various vacancies. The scheme is implemented by the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities, Dehradun.
Benefits: Employment Registration: Registers unemployed individuals who are visually impaired and have low vision.Job Placement Assistance: Provides suitable employment opportunities in the public sector and private agencies.
Eligibility: The applicant should be visually impaired or a person with low vision.The applicant should be unemployed at the time of registration.
Application_Process: OfflineStep 1: The interested applicant should visit the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun.Step 2: The institute assists visually impaired individuals by providing them with application forms--both online and offline--for various posts advertised in employment news.Website: niepvd.nic.inTelephone No.: 0135-2736712Email: tcab-niepvd@nivh.gov.in
Documents_Required: Disability CertificateUnique Disability ID (UDID) CardAadhaar CardEducational Qualification CertificatesAny other documents as required.
